column3: was here to day to watch a japanese animation, it was quite nice and comfortable. parking was easy and smooth
LA's best undiscovered park, like what Echo Park would be if it were not overrun by tourists. Stroll, relax, have a picnic, take a nap on the grass. It's perfect for all these things.

Some friends gave us tickets to see a musical group called "Klezmer Juice." We had no idea what it would be like. It turned out to be a group of musicians who performed jazzed-up versions of Hebrew and Yiddish folk songs. Interesting concept, but who really wants to listen to songs like "Hava Nagila" for two hours??
